metadata.title: CVE-2017-5048 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow in FFmpeg in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 forMac, Windows, and Linux and 57.0.2987.108 for Android allowed a remoteattacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted video file,related to ChunkDemuxer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu0.14.04.1174').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
